## Description {#details}

Helper class to promote a scalar operation to a vector one.

This class is used to move downward extractelement transition. E.g., a = vector&#95;op &lt;2 x i32&gt; b = extractelement &lt;2 x i32&gt; a, i32 0 c = scalar&#95;op b store c

=&gt; a = vector&#95;op &lt;2 x i32&gt; c = vector&#95;op a (equivalent to scalar&#95;op on the related lane)
<ul>
<li>d = extractelement &lt;2 x i32&gt; c, i32 0</li>
<li>store d Assuming both extractelement and store can be combine, we get rid of the transition.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 7873 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Functions

### getConstantVector() {#a1b77018248b7328e452c6d06a12c65da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;CodeGenPrepare.cpp&#125;::VectorPromoteHelper::getConstantVector (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42; Val, bool UseSplat) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Generate a constant vector with <code>Val</code> with the same number of elements as the transition.

<code>UseSplat</code> defines whether or not <code>Val</code> should be replicated across the whole vector. In other words, if UseSplat == true, we generate &lt;Val, Val, ..., Val&gt;, otherwise we generate a vector with as many poison as possible: &lt;poison, ..., poison, Val, poison, ..., poison&gt; where <code>Val</code> is only used at the index of the extract.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l08000">8000</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getEndOfTransition() {#ad98f94c959acccb0b1a8587667aa5da6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;CodeGenPrepare.cpp&#125;::VectorPromoteHelper::getEndOfTransition () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The instruction that represents the current end of the transition.

Since we are faking the promotion until we reach the end of the chain of computation, we need a way to get the current end of the transition.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l07898">7898</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the index of the index in the transition.

E.g., for &quot;extractelement &lt;2 x i32&gt; c, i32 0&quot; the index is at index 1.

E.g., for &quot;extractelement &lt;2 x i32&gt; c, i32 1&quot; the original value, c, is at index 0.

Get the type of the transition.

This is the type of the original value. E.g., for &quot;extractelement &lt;2 x i32&gt; c, i32 1&quot; the type of the transition is &lt;2 x i32&gt;.

### promoteImpl() {#ab39e199e91b6ce86900a932b181a1f17}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void VectorPromoteHelper::promoteImpl (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; ToBePromoted)</>}>
Promote <code>ToBePromoted</code> by moving <code>Def</code> downward through.

I.e., we have the following sequence: Def = Transition &lt;ty1&gt; a to &lt;ty2&gt; b = ToBePromoted &lt;ty2&gt; Def, ... =&gt; b = ToBePromoted &lt;ty1&gt; a, ... Def = Transition &lt;ty1&gt; ToBePromoted to &lt;ty2&gt;

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l07937">7937</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
